channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel and Hamas prepare for hostage exchange. And, the DOJ indicts Letitia James
item.description: Israel and Hamas are preparing for a hostage exchange as the first phase of the signed ceasefire deal. And, the Justice Department has indicted Letitia James after pressure from President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Israel and Hamas are preparing for a hostage exchange as the first phase of the signed ceasefire deal. And, the Justice Department has indicted Letitia James after pressure from President Trump.

(Image credit: Jack Guez)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Israel says it has completed a pullback of troops in Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces have completed a pullback of troops from Gaza on Friday after Israel's Cabinet approved a plan for a ceasefire aimed at ending the devastating two-year war.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli forces have completed a pullback of troops from Gaza on Friday after Israel's Cabinet approved a plan for a ceasefire aimed at ending the devastating two-year war.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: In the age of algorithms, one Irish town still does love the old-fashioned way
item.description: Most won't leave the town of Lisdoonvarna with a partner. But for a few nights each fall, they find something rarer — company, ritual and the comfort of not looking for love alone.
item.content:encoded:
Most won't leave the town of Lisdoonvarna with a partner. But for a few nights each fall, they find something rarer — company, ritual and the comfort of not looking for love alone.

(Image credit: Rob Stothard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado wins 2025 Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado has won this year's Nobel Peace Prize for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado has won this year's Nobel Peace Prize for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Unlike the government, our quiz writer is still at work. Can you ace her test?
item.description: It's Nobel season — but other stuff happened, too. If you're up on France, legacy media and authors both high- and low-brow, you'll get at least four questions right.
item.content:encoded: It's Nobel season — but other stuff happened, too. If you're up on France, legacy media and authors both high- and low-brow, you'll get at least four questions right.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: María Corina Machado of Venezuela awarded Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Norwegian Nobel Committee said Machado's work promoting democratic rights is "one of the most extraordinary examples of civilian courage in Latin America in recent times.
item.content:encoded: The Norwegian Nobel Committee said Machado's work promoting democratic rights is "one of the most extraordinary examples of civilian courage in Latin America in recent times.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Sora gives deepfakes 'a publicist and a distribution deal.' It could change the internet
item.description: OpenAI's new hit app has unleashed a new wave of AI slop across the internet. But what happens when there are no rules over hyper-realistic synthetic videos?
item.content:encoded:
OpenAI's new hit app has unleashed a new wave of AI slop across the internet. But what happens when there are no rules over hyper-realistic synthetic videos?

(Image credit: OpenAI)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Remembering primate expert and conservationist Jane Goodall
item.description: Goodall, who died Oct. 1, became one of the most famous scientists of the 20th century for her work observing chimpanzees in the wild in East Africa. Originally broadcast in 1993 and 1999.
item.content:encoded: Goodall, who died Oct. 1, became one of the most famous scientists of the 20th century for her work observing chimpanzees in the wild in East Africa. Originally broadcast in 1993 and 1999.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Social Security workers say the shutdown has them unable to help with benefit letters
item.description: Employees at Social Security field offices say the government shutdown has left them unable to carry out an important service: help recipients with benefit verification letters.
item.content:encoded:
Employees at Social Security field offices say the government shutdown has left them unable to carry out an important service: help recipients with benefit verification letters.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Where has Trump suggested sending troops? In cities run by Democratic mayors
item.description: In just four months, Trump has suggested or ordered sending federal intervention to nearly a dozen cities.
item.content:encoded:
In just four months, Trump has suggested or ordered sending federal intervention to nearly a dozen cities.

(Image credit: Stacey Wescott)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
